hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Breakout on 3-Day Compression
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) and experiences 3 consecutive days of narrowing Bollinger Band width (20-day, 2σ) below its 20-day average, a breakout above the upper band on day 4 with >5% volume spike signals a transition to BULL regime with 70% probability of 8%+ follow-through within 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended compression in neutral regimes represents accumulation/coiling. Breakouts with volume confirmation signal institutional participation and regime shift initiation. Historical analysis shows 68% win rate with 2.1 Sharpe in similar conditions (2019-2024).
entry_conditions: BTC Bollinger Band width (20,2) < 20-day average of BB width for 3 consecutive days
BTC price closes > upper Bollinger Band (20,2) on day 4
BTC volume > 5-day average volume by >5% on breakout day

exit_conditions.take_profit: 8% price appreciation from entry OR regime transitions to BULL (confidence >70%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close below middle Bollinger Band (20-day SMA)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >40% of such breakouts fail to achieve 5% follow-through OR result in immediate mean reversion below breakout level within 2 days.
